name: Bocconcini Salad
author: Angel
summary: Bite-size balls of fresh mozzarella, known as bocconcini, make up this great salad.  If possible, seek out mozzarella di bufala, made from water buffalo's milk; a specialty of central and southern Italy, it is a softer, creamier mozzarella than that made from cow's milk.
ingredients: ½ cup chopped green bell pepper
½ cup coarsely chopped arugula, stems included
salt and freshly ground black pepper
directions: In a large salad bowl, combine the mozzarella, cherry tomatoes, bell pepper, celery, endive and arugula
Whisk together the lemon juice and olive oil; pour over the salad
Toss until all the ingredients are thoroughly coated with the dressing
Transfer salad to individual serving plates, if desired
Sprinkle the basil over the salad, season with salt and pepper, and serve immediately
